cons: The high amount of nondigestible fiber in beans may cause gastrointestinal problems if you aren't used to eating them.
Improve your absorption of iron by eating beans along with meat, seafood or poultry or by eating beans with a source of vitamin C, such as oranges or bell peppers
description: Yard-long beans are one of the ancient cultivated crops.The pods contain large quantities of soluble and insoluble fibers.
Fresh yard-long beans are one of the finest sources of folates.Folate along with vitamin B-12 is one of the essential components of DNA synthesis and cell division.

Fresh beans contain a good amount of vitamin-C. Vitamin-C is a powerful water-soluble antioxidant, and when adequately provided in the diet, it helps build immunity to combat infections, contribute to maintaining blood vessel elasticity, and offer some protection from cancers.

It is a excellent sources of vitamin-A.Vitamin-A is one of the essential vitamins for the body provided through our diet. Vitamin-A maintains mucosal integrity, enhances skin complexion, and improves night vision.
name: Yardlong Beans
pros: Yard-long beans are one of the ancient cultivated crops.The pods contain large quantities of soluble and insoluble fibers.
Fresh yard-long beans are one of the finest sources of folates.Folate along with vitamin B-12 is one of the essential components of DNA synthesis and cell division.

Fresh beans contain a good amount of vitamin-C. Vitamin-C is a powerful water-soluble antioxidant, and when adequately provided in the diet, it helps build immunity to combat infections, contribute to maintaining blood vessel elasticity, and offer some protection from cancers.

It is a excellent sources of vitamin-A.Vitamin-A is one of the essential vitamins for the body provided through our diet. Vitamin-A maintains mucosal integrity, enhances skin complexion, and improves night vision.
pregnancy may help prevent neural-tube defects in the newborns.
Fiber rich food also found to reduce LDL-cholesterol levels by decreasing reabsorption of cholesterol binding bile acids in the colon.
Yard long beans provide average amounts of minerals such as iron, copper, manganese, calcium, magnesium.
The body uses manganese as a cofactor for the important antioxidant enzyme, superoxide dismutase.
